content.user_title: Manage medical device risk with ISO 14971 frameworks
content.value_statement: Medical device companies face complex risk management requirements across product lifecycles. This skill provides expert guidance for implementing ISO 14971 risk management processes including hazard identification, risk estimation, control measures, and post-market surveillance.
actual_capabilities: Implement ISO 14971 risk management processes throughout product lifecycle
Conduct hazard identification and risk analysis for medical devices
Apply risk estimation methodologies using probability and severity matrices
Develop risk control measures following hierarchy of controls framework
Integrate risk management with QMS, design controls, and regulatory submissions
Manage production and post-production risk monitoring and file maintenance
limitations: Does not replace qualified regulatory affairs professionals for formal submissions
Does not provide legal advice on compliance requirements
Does not execute actual risk assessments or generate regulatory documents
Skill provides guidance and frameworks only, users must apply to their specific context

use_cases.title: Build risk management processes
use_cases.description: Establish ISO 14971 compliant risk management frameworks integrated with design controls and CAPA systems.

use_cases.title: Prepare regulatory submissions
use_cases.description: Coordinate risk management documentation for FDA 510(k), PMA, EU MDR, and ISO 13485 certification audits.

use_cases.title: Apply software risk management
use_cases.description: Integrate IEC 62304 software lifecycle processes with risk management for software as medical device (SaMD).

prompt_templates.title: Risk Management Plan
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a new risk management plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a risk management plan for a new Class II medical device following ISO 14971. Include risk management objectives, scope, acceptability criteria, team responsibilities, and file maintenance protocols.

prompt_templates.title: Hazard Identification
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct hazard identification for an infusion pump system. Consider mechanical, electrical, software, and use-related hazards. Include hazardous situations and foreseeable misuse scenarios.

prompt_templates.title: Risk Control Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop risk control measures for a surgical robot system. Apply the hierarchy of controls (inherent safety, protective measures, information for safety). Include verification strategies for each control.

prompt_templates.title: Post-Market Surveillance
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a production and post-production information collection process for a Class III cardiac device. Include risk signal detection methods, file update protocols, and benefit-risk analysis review cycles.

output_examples.input: What are the key elements of ISO 14971 risk management for a new medical device?
output: Risk Management Plan: Defines objectives, scope, criteria, responsibilities
Risk Analysis: Intended use, hazard identification, risk estimation
Risk Evaluation: Acceptability assessment against defined criteria
Risk Control: Hierarchy implementation (design, protective measures, information)
Production and Post-Production: Information collection, file updates, ongoing monitoring

output_examples.input: How do I integrate risk management with design controls?
output: Link risk analysis outputs to design input requirements
Ensure design verification addresses risk control effectiveness
Document risk-benefit decisions in design history file
Conduct design change impact assessments for risk file updates
Integrate risk management review into design review milestones

output_examples.input: What should be included in a cybersecurity risk assessment?
output: Asset identification: Device components, data flows, attack surfaces
Threat modeling: Attack vectors, threat sources, exploitation paths
Vulnerability assessment: Software weaknesses, authentication gaps
Impact assessment: Patient safety, device functionality, data privacy
Risk control: Preventive, detective, and corrective security measures

best_practices: Define risk acceptability criteria early and document rationale for each decision
Apply the hierarchy of risk controls: prioritize inherent safety by design over protective measures and information
Maintain bidirectional traceability between hazards, risks, controls, and verification results
anti_patterns: Avoid defining risk acceptability criteria without clinical input or justification
Do not skip hazard identification for life-critical components
Avoid treating risk management as a documentation exercise rather than a safety process

faq.question: What is ISO 14971?
faq.answer: ISO 14971 is the international standard for medical device risk management. It provides a framework for identifying, evaluating, and controlling risks throughout the product lifecycle.

faq.question: How does this skill help with FDA submissions?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance on integrating risk management documentation with FDA 510(k) and PMA submission requirements, including risk analysis summaries.

faq.question: What is the hierarchy of risk controls?
faq.answer: The hierarchy prioritizes: (1) Inherent safety by design, (2) Protective measures, (3) Information for safety. This approach maximizes risk reduction.

faq.question: How do I integrate IEC 62304 with ISO 14971?
faq.answer: Link software safety classification to risk analysis, ensure software hazard analysis contributes to the overall risk management file, and document software-specific controls.

faq.question: What is included in production and post-production information?
faq.answer: This includes customer complaints, adverse event reports, production data, servicing records, and any information that could affect original risk assessment conclusions.

faq.question: How often should risk management files be reviewed?
faq.answer: Conduct periodic reviews at defined intervals (typically annually) and whenever significant changes occur to the device, intended use, or available post-market information.
